timeline.bodyText: Since we parse the header lazily now, what is causing this exception?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: The exception is caused by headerKeyBuffer.limit(headerKeySize);. The new limit is larger than capacity
replies.author: chia7712

timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText:
Why did we change this?

run JMH with uncompressed data.
The alternative way is that we can add an new benchmark for assignOffsetsNonCompressed. However, the test data of this class includes both uncompressed and compressed so it is weird to input compressed data to test assignOffsetsNonCompressed.
replies.author: chia7712

replies.bodyText: Right, but the goal of this benchmark was to test the compressed case where there is additional overhead due to compression buffer allocation and so on. As you say, it would be better to have another benchmark for the uncompressed case.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText:
it would be better to have another benchmark for the uncompressed case.

I creates two new classes - CompressedRecordBatchValidationBenchmark and UncompressedRecordBatchValidationBenchmark. They use different compression type and measure different validation function.
